stories.text: I often find that reading the comments on a HN post lead to more insights than simply reading the linked website alone or just the OP, so in the spirit of HN as a link aggregator: What HN threads have most contributed to the way you think about startups now?
stories.title: Ask HN: What HN threads most influenced your thinking about startups?

stories.text:
I am looking for tooling that can be used to create comprehensive, explanatory blog posts on scientific papers in the field of deep learning. The blog posts themselves should meet the basic requirements of scientific work, so it would be helpful, for example, if citations were supported.

I first thought about Jupyter Notebooks, but I don't think it's suitable for writing longer texts, and it also lacks citation management. Another idea would be Bookdown, but then the result looks more like a book than a blog. I am grateful for recommendations!
stories.title: Ask HN: What to create in-depth scientific blog posts with
We Can't Wait for Universities to Fix Themselves. So We're Starting a New One
Smartmatic sues OANN, Newsmax over claims it rigged voting machines for Biden
I “hacked” tickets worth € 30.000 at the Websummit for a good cause
A Botched Circumcision and Its Aftermath
Rise of the Robots Speeds Up in Pandemic with U.S. Labor Scarce
